meanings.definition: a person who believes that nothing is known or can be known of the existence or nature of God
meanings.sent1: As an agnosticism, Sarah always questioned the existence of God.
meanings.sent2: John's agnosticism led him to explore various philosophies about God.
meanings.sent3: The agnosticism in the room sparked an interesting debate about faith.
meanings.sent4: Her agnosticism was like a fog, obscuring any clear view of religious beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The agnosticism of the scientist was a barrier to accepting any religious doctrine.

meanings.definition: a person who is unsure or noncommittal about the existence of God
meanings.sent1: His agnosticism made it difficult for him to choose a religion.
meanings.sent2: The agnosticism of the philosopher left room for doubt in all matters of faith.
meanings.sent3: The agnosticism of the cat regarding the existence of a higher power was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: In a world of certainty, her agnosticism stood out like a lone tree in a field.
meanings.sent5: The agnosticism of the child was like a blank canvas waiting to be painted with beliefs.
